alert.note: Alert for Bourbon (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 12 at 3:49AM EST until December 12 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Stoner Creek at Paris affecting Bourbon County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Stoner Creek at Paris. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water floods a few low roads on right bank of creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 AM EST Sunday the stage was 16.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 13.9 feet late tomorrow evening. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding is possible and rivers are forecast to exceed bankfull. If you are in the advisory area remain alert to possible flooding, or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued around 10:30 AM this morning.
